core:processNote.core:description: Declined doesn't necessarily mean Declined for refunds.

core:action.core:comment: Check floor limits, assuming online refund is enabled. AVSCheckRequired will not be set for refunds.
We can't suspend in the middle of an ICC transaction. They must remove the card and start again.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: Declined is the new approved for refund
Not Complete. Completely skip online auth for contactless refund.

core:action.core:comment: We use this to clear the 'Transaction Approved' message from the ICC Reader.

core:executeProcessAction.core:comment: Performs an online request if necessary to re-crypt the Miura Track2 data, then discards Encrypted Track2 data.

core:assignAction.core:comment: As for swiped etc, assume we are not capturing Online PIN for refunds. To be clear, reset the flag which may have been set for the card.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: MUST go online if auth and settle in one

If we were forced online (e.g. because of online refund) but was not requested by card, don't try to call complete. But if we do call complete, the assumption is that the PED outcome will be declined.

core:action.core:comment: Only call the reader completion step if required, otherwise an error will occur.

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: If we were forced online (e.g. because of online refund) but was not requested by card, don't try to call complete.

core:state.core:comment: Issue change if required. TODO - determine if change is actually needed before starting change process?

core:eventLink.core:comment: This process prints the store copy voucher so we go in here for CNP as well

core:state.core:comment: If tenderId is specified on the input, we load this tender and use it to check basic restrictions. This check is not accurate if we later allow the captured card to set the actual tender used to something else (which we do).
